item.title: Parsonsia brownii
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: Creeper growing through low shrubbery. One of a young group of plants to maximum height of about 1m. Looks to have potential to climb much higher, similar to clematis. Tiny flower. Diameter 5mm. 2 pics uploaded (one of leaves).

item.title: Veronica serpyllifolia
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: Tiny grassland plant. 10cm high. Flower 5mm diameter. 100s of plants over a few square metres.

item.title: Veronica serpyllifolia
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: Tiny plant in damp grassland. 10cm high. Flowers 5mm diameter. 100s of plants over about 5 square metres.

item.title: Hovea asperifolia subsp. asperifolia
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: Gembrook variant. Small upright tree or shrub. Tallest in this community is over 2 metres in height.

item.title: Viburnum tinus
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: Introduced species. Recently noticed growing on roadside reserve. Identified by Lewis Hiller - Plant Identification Australia (Facebook).

item.title: Utricularia gibba
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: Growing in shallow water in a forest dam. Noticed in two places about 1km apart. Identified as such by Kelly Bollinger (Facebook - Plant Identification Australia). Three photos uploaded. Native species. Common elsewhere in Australia but unusual in Victoria.

item.title: Oxylobium arborescens
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: Small community of about 6 plants observed. Identified from Costermans 'Native Trees & Shrubs of South-Eastern Australia' and RBG 'Vicflora' website.

item.title: Olearia lirata
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: Olearia lirata possibly with a fungal infection

item.title: Tetratheca stenocarpa
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: Widespread in the Hoddles Creek - Gembrook area. Scattered and sparse blooms through late autumn and early winter but putting on a colourful show in August, September and October.

item.title: Correa reflexa var. lobata
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: Shrub View. May 2016. Flowers can be seen from late April to August.

item.title: Correa reflexa var. lobata
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: One for the Archives. Photographed April 2016. Apparently rare in Victoria but prolific between Gembrook, Hoddles Creek and Powelltown.

item.title: Hibbertia empetrifolia subsp. empetrifolia s.s.
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: My uneducated guess is H.empetrifolia but I have some doubt as I cannot see any pics of that species on natureshare. Showy plant at the moment which trails, scrambles and climbs over other plants and logs. Locally common in Gembrook area. Please comment if I.D. is incorrect and I will change it. Underside of foliage has fine sparse hairs along the vein which appears to concur with Vicflora description.

item.title: Goodia lotifolia s.s.
item.dc:creator: abcmaps
item.description: Beside Mount Riddell Walking Track. Flora of Melbourne mentions alternative name 'Clover Tree'. Not sure if s.l. or s.s.
